page.title: 05PRESTON FARMERS:history
page.content: Claughton Depot opened in 1974 as Lunesdale Farmers which joined with Lakes Farmers and then Preston Farmers which has 14 other branches.Four flat- bed Leyland lorries distribute animal feed,fertilisers and agro-chemicals as far north as Tebay,east to Settle and west into the Lake District.A fuel tanker supplies central heating oil and diesel anywhere in the North.The cash and carry shop opened in 1985 in response to customer demand and as a buffer against a bad year selling feed. It supplies agricultural hardware, workwear,petfood,detergents,etc. There are twelve employees at Claughton who all live within a five mile radius.
